Notes: Schools in the Democratic Republic of Congo are fully open.    See: https://web.archive.org/web/20220221140632/https://en.unesco.org/covid19/educationresponse

Gatherings of more than 50 people are prohibited, with the exception of public markets, which are open on weekdays (except Wednesday) and Saturday.    See: https://web.archive.org/web/20220221143250/https://cd.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/

Gatherings of more than 50 people are prohibited, with the exception of public markets, which are open on weekdays (except Wednesday) and Saturday.    See: https://web.archive.org/web/20220221143250/https://cd.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/

Transportation Options:    Are commercial flights operating? Yes  Is public transportation operating? Yes  Masks are required in public, including on public transportation and at all airports.    See: https://web.archive.org/web/20220221143250/https://cd.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/

The following measures are in place and may be amended at short notice:  a curfew remains in place in Pointe-Noire and Brazzaville from 11pm until 5am.    See: https://web.archive.org/web/20220221143433/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/congo/coronavirus

Domestic travelers age 11 and older are required to present a negative COVID-19 test for travel between the provinces when departing from Kinshasa, Lubumbashi, Bukavu, Goma, and Kisangani.  Where possible, the test must be taken within 7 days of travel.    See: https://web.archive.org/web/20220221143250/https://cd.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/

Face masks must be worn in all public places.    See: https://web.archive.org/web/20220221143433/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/congo/coronavirus

The Republic of the Congo national vaccination programme started in March 2021 and is using the Sputnik V, Sinopharm, and Janssen (Johnson and Johnson) vaccines. British nationals resident in the Republic of the Congo are eligible for vaccination, depending on available stocks, if they choose to join the programme. Further information on the vaccination programme can be found at the emergency Public Health Operations Centre of the Ministry of Health and Population, or at the vaccination centre at the Ministry of Foreign Affairs.    See: https://web.archive.org/web/20220221143433/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/congo/coronavirus

Basic services (i.e., grocery stores, gas stations, transportation etc.) are available in Nigeria, and schools have resumed.    Archived website: https://web.archive.org/web/20220221052118/https://ng.usembassy.gov/u-s-citizen-services/covid-19-information/

Basic services (i.e., grocery stores, gas stations, transportation etc.) are available in Nigeria, and schools have resumed.    Archived website: https://web.archive.org/web/20220221052118/https://ng.usembassy.gov/u-s-citizen-services/covid-19-information/

Events are limited to a maximum of 50% of the capacity of the facility.  Social distancing, temperature checks, and mask wearing are required.    Archived website: https://web.archive.org/web/20220221052118/https://ng.usembassy.gov/u-s-citizen-services/covid-19-information/

Gatherings of over 50 people outside of work places are prohibited, including all weddings, conferences and sporting events. Places of worship are permitted to hold services, subject to limitations set by state authorities.    Archived websites:  https://web.archive.org/web/20220221203915/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/nigeria/coronavirus   https://web.archive.org/web/20220221052118/https://ng.usembassy.gov/u-s-citizen-services/covid-19-information/

Public transports are operating with recommendation of limiting passenger numbers to 50% capacity. 1. COVID-19 PCR test to be done within 48 hours of departure for all travelers   2. Post-arrival Day-2 COVID-19 PCR test for all travelers   3. Self-isolation for 7 days for partially vaccinated and unvaccinated travelers and a Day-7 post-arrival negative COVID-19 PCR test is required for exit from isolation.  5. Persons who are unvaccinated or partially vaccinated who test negative for COVID-19 after 7 days of self-isolation/quarantine will be allowed to exit self-isolation on receipt of their result.   6. Fully vaccinated persons who test negative for COVID-19 after the post-arrival Day 2 test MUST continue to observe Non-Pharmaceutical Intervention measures (e.g., wearing face mask, maintaining social distance, regular washing of hands and use of alcohol-based hand sanitizers);     Archived webpage: https://web.archive.org/web/20220219182215/https://covid19.ncdc.gov.ng/media/files/Revised_Travel_Protocol_021221_NCDC_Ako_v.2.pdf
No new policy update
No new policy update

There is a dedicated COVID-19 website, https://covid19.ncdc.gov.ng/, with associated dashboards for various social media handles. There is also a dedicated Toll-free number, 6232. Enlightenment messages are also broadcasted on traditional media including radio and TV, as well as new media such as SMS and social media message. Also, the NCDC provides public health advisories as the pandemic evolves.
